title: Herb Plant Growing Tips for Balcony Planters

items.name: Mint
items.details: Very versatile but notorious for being invasive with its roots. Always keep it in its own separate pot or container to prevent it from taking over.

items.name: Rosemary
items.details: Hardy, useful in cooking, and well-behaved with roots. Pairs well as a companion to basil and mint in a collection.

items.name: Basil
items.details: Great starter herb for a collection.

items.name: General tip
items.details: Keep herbs in separate pots in hanging planters rather than combining them. This gives each herb its own space to thrive and prevents aggressive spreaders like mint from crowding others.

notes: Recommended herb trio for beginners: basil, mint, and rosemary.
